div.p: An implementation guide can define default profiles - these are profiles that apply to any resource that does not otherwise have an explicit profile assigned by the implementation guide. Default profiles are always references to profiles (StructureDefinition resources) that are also contained in the resources. By defining default profiles, an implementation guide can save itself from exhaustively defining profiles on every resource type just to profile every reference to a particular resource type.
Note that a resource can conform to the default profile by conforming to any profile derived from it.
This table declares the compatibility between the various resources as determined by the Implementation Guide comparison tool:
